title: Perform virus scanning with macOS Clamav
body:
I don't want to make Clamav resident, but I would like to use a regular full scan to ensure safety, so I will introduce how to do it.

## environment

M1 MacBook Air

## install

Install using Homebrew.

`` `bash
$ BREW INSTALL CLAMAV
`` `

## Update vulnerability/virus pattern

### Preparation of configuration file

Use what is prepared by default.

`` `bash
$ cp /opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf.sample /opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf
`` `

Eliminate the example line from `/opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf`.


### Update vulnerability/virus pattern


`` `bash
$ FreshClam
`` `

## Running Scan

Scan the home directory.

`` `bash
$ Calmscan ~/ --recursive --infecteded
`` `

`--recursive`: Verify the contents of the file recursively.
`-infected`: Limited the output content to only virus files.

## Scan result

`` `bash
---------- SCAN SUMMARY -----------------------------------
Known Viruses: 8615816
Engine Version: 0.105.0
Scanned Directories: 96767
Scanned Files: 574546
INFECTED FILES: 0
TOTAL ERRORS: 102
Data Scanned: 33283.79 MB
Data Read: 101097.09 MB (Ratio 0.33: 1)
Time: 2366.628 SEC (39 M 26 S)
Start Date: 2022: 05: 08 10:42:33
End Date: 2022: 05: 08 11:22:00
`` `

## Regular execution

`` `bash
$ crontab -e
`` `

Pattern update at 0:00 on Sunday/Home directory scan execution

`` `bash
0 0 * * 0 FreshClam & Clamscan/Users/Kemu/--recursive --infected
`` `
